destinations.name: Nairobi
destinations.shortDescription: Kenya's vibrant capital serves as your gateway. Modern hotels provide comfortable rest before and after your wilderness adventures through the Northern conservancies and coast.

destinations.name: Laikipia Plateau / Lewa
destinations.shortDescription: A UNESCO World Heritage Site protecting 10% of Kenya's entire rhino population and 20% of critically endangered Grevy's zebra. Experience exclusive wildlife encounters with only 2-3 other vehicles maximum.

destinations.name: Samburu & Sera Conservancy
destinations.shortDescription: Home to East Africa's first and only community-owned black rhino sanctuary. Track rhinos on foot through doum palm groves and witness the 'Samburu Special Five' found nowhere else in Kenya.

destinations.name: Matthews Range
destinations.shortDescription: A pristine 'sky island' with tropical highland forest evolved in isolation for 10,000+ years. Home to 400+ forest elephants, rare De Brazza's monkeys, melanistic leopards, and over 200 bird species.

destinations.name: Loita Hills
destinations.shortDescription: Experience the sacred 'Forest of the Lost Child' with authentic Maasai cultural immersion. 100% community-owned where tourism revenue directly funds schools and women's empowerment programs.

destinations.name: Lamu Archipelago
destinations.shortDescription: A UNESCO World Heritage Site with over 700 years of Swahili culture. Lamu Old Town remains car-free, navigated only by donkeys and dhows with pristine beaches and perfect diving conditions.

destinations.name: Masai Mara National Reserve
destinations.shortDescription: Kenya's most celebrated safari destination, home to the world-famous Great Migration and exceptional Big Five sightings. Witness millions of wildebeest crossing the crocodile-filled Mara River.

destinations.name: Amboseli National Park
destinations.shortDescription: Land of the Giants featuring iconic elephant herds against the backdrop of Mount Kilimanjaro. Home to over 1,000 elephants and the longest-running elephant research project in the world.

destinations.name: Diani Beach
destinations.shortDescription: Kenya's tropical paradise featuring 17 kilometers of pristine white sand beaches and crystal-clear turquoise waters. Perfect coastal retreat combining relaxation with water sports and marine adventures.

destinations.name: Lake Nakuru National Park
destinations.shortDescription: The Pink Paradise featuring millions of flamingos and one of Africa's finest rhino sanctuaries in the Great Rift Valley with over 450 bird species.

destinations.name: Tsavo National Parks
destinations.shortDescription: Kenya's largest wilderness featuring the legendary red elephants and untamed African landscapes across nearly 22,000 square kilometers.

destinations.name: Mount Kenya
destinations.shortDescription: Africa's second-highest mountain, a UNESCO World Heritage Site with glaciers, alpine lakes, and unique afro-alpine ecosystems found nowhere else on Earth.

destinations.name: Hell's Gate National Park
destinations.shortDescription: Kenya's only park where you can walk, cycle, and climb among wild animals. Dramatic gorges, geothermal activity, and the inspiration for The Lion King scenery.

destinations.name: Lake Naivasha
destinations.shortDescription: Freshwater oasis in the Rift Valley with boat safaris, Crescent Island walks among wildlife, and over 400 bird species in a serene lakeside paradise.

destinations.name: Ol Pejeta Conservancy
destinations.shortDescription: East Africa's largest black rhino sanctuary with the world's last two northern white rhinos, the only place in Kenya to see chimpanzees, and the most diverse activities of any conservancy.

destinations.name: Watamu
destinations.shortDescription: UNESCO Biosphere Reserve with pristine coral reefs, endangered sea turtle nesting sites, and some of Kenya's most spectacular snorkeling and diving in crystal-clear waters.

destinations.name: Kakamega Forest
destinations.shortDescription: Kenya's only tropical rainforest and last remnant of the ancient Guineo-Congolian rainforest, home to 367 bird species including 16 found nowhere else in Kenya, and rare primates.

destinations.name: Meru National Park
destinations.shortDescription: Remote wilderness park made famous by 'Born Free,' home to Elsa the lioness's grave, featuring an 84km¬≤ rhino sanctuary with 100+ rhinos and minimal tourist traffic for authentic safari experiences.

destinations.name: Lake Bogoria National Reserve
destinations.shortDescription: Dramatic Rift Valley lake with Africa's highest concentration of true geysers (18+ active), boiling hot springs reaching 98.5¬∞C, and tens of thousands of flamingos painting the shores pink.

destinations.name: Aberdare National Park
destinations.shortDescription: Misty mountain park at 2,286m altitude featuring The Ark lodge overlooking floodlit waterholes, spectacular waterfalls including Karuru Falls, and unique afro-alpine moorlands with rare wildlife.

destinations.name: Chyulu Hills National Park
destinations.shortDescription: One of Earth's youngest volcanic mountain ranges (under 500 years old) featuring Leviathan Cave - Africa's longest lava tube at 11km - with stunning Kilimanjaro views and grassland elephants.

destinations.name: Shimba Hills National Reserve
destinations.shortDescription: Kenya's largest coastal rainforest with 700 elephants (the country's highest density), rare sable antelopes found nowhere else in Kenya, and Shimba Hills Lodge - the only tree lodge on the coast.

destinations.name: Mombasa
destinations.shortDescription: Kenya's historic coastal city featuring UNESCO World Heritage Fort Jesus (built 1593), the atmospheric Old Town with carved Swahili doors, pristine beaches at Nyali and Bamburi, and vibrant Swahili culture.

destinations.name: Lake Baringo
destinations.shortDescription: Freshwater Rift Valley lake hosting over 470 bird species (one-third of Kenya's total), with Gibraltar Island's famous Goliath heronry, resident hippos and Nile crocodiles, and peaceful boat safaris.

destinations.name: Mount Longonot National Park
destinations.shortDescription: Stratovolcano with last eruption in 1860s, featuring a challenging 2-hour hike to the crater rim at 2,776m, and a spectacular 7.2km loop trail around the crater with Rift Valley panoramas - perfect day trip from Nairobi (60km).

destinations.name: Malindi
destinations.shortDescription: Historic coastal town featuring Vasco da Gama Pillar (erected 1498 - Kenya's oldest European monument), UNESCO Biosphere Reserve marine park with pristine coral reefs, and stunning white sand beaches.

destinations.name: Solio Ranch Conservancy
destinations.shortDescription: Kenya's first private rhino sanctuary (established 1970) with over 200 black and white rhinos - the most rhino-dense area in Kenya. Has bred and translocated 145+ rhinos to stock reserves across Africa, plus four of the Big Five.

destinations.name: Lake Turkana
destinations.shortDescription: The 'Jade Sea' - world's largest desert lake and largest alkaline lake, UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring Koobi Fora fossil beds with groundbreaking human evolution discoveries, the world's largest Nile crocodile population, and remote authentic adventure.

destinations.name: Kisumu
destinations.shortDescription: Kenya's lakeside gem on Lake Victoria's shores, offering sunset boat cruises, fresh tilapia, Kit Mikayi rock formations, and authentic Luo culture - all at budget-friendly prices.

destinations.name: Kericho Tea Plantations
destinations.shortDescription: Kenya's tea capital with rolling green plantations, factory tours from picking to processing, budget camping at Chesumot for 1000 KSH, and authentic agro-tourism experiences in the highlands.

destinations.name: Menengai Crater
destinations.shortDescription: One of the world's largest volcanic calderas just 10km from Nakuru, with budget-friendly KFS entrance (200 KSH residents), stunning Rift Valley viewpoints accessible by car, and challenging 4-5 hour crater hikes.

destinations.name: Arabuko Sokoke Forest
destinations.shortDescription: East Africa's largest intact coastal forest spanning 420 sq km, home to the rare Sokoke Scops Owl found nowhere else, with budget guides at $25/day and camping at Gede Ruins Camp.

destinations.name: Kisite-Mpunguti Marine Park
destinations.shortDescription: Kenya's most magnificent marine park near Shimoni featuring 250+ fish species, 200+ dolphins in wild pods, crystal-clear snorkeling, and boat trips to Wasini Island with fresh seafood lunches.

destinations.name: Karura Forest
destinations.shortDescription: Nairobi's 1,000-hectare urban forest sanctuary with entrance as low as $1, featuring a 14-meter waterfall, Mau Mau freedom fighter caves, 50km of trails, and over 200 bird species.

destinations.name: Taita Hills Wildlife Sanctuary
destinations.shortDescription: UNESCO biodiversity hotspot in the Eastern Arc Mountains spanning 113 sq km, home to 50+ mammal species including Big Five, 300+ bird species, and endangered Taita thrush, apalis, and white-eye.

destinations.name: Saiwa Swamp National Park
destinations.shortDescription: Kenya's smallest national park at just 3 sq km near Kitale, created to protect the rare aquatic sitatunga antelope with elongated hooves, featuring 372 bird species and walking-only trails with observation platforms.

destinations.name: Nairobi National Park
destinations.shortDescription: The world's only national park within a capital city, just 7km from Nairobi's CBD, featuring lions, black rhinos, giraffes against the city skyline, with entrance $80 for international visitors.

destinations.name: Gedi Ruins
destinations.shortDescription: Kenya's 8th UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring a mysterious 15th-17th century Swahili city with palace, mosque, and stone houses, entrance 1,000 KSH, surrounded by Arabuko Sokoke Forest with Sykes' monkeys.
